_exec_summary.SummaryText:
1. Executive Summary
This program is intended to meet the spirit and intent of the following regulations:
- California Accidental Release Prevention (CalARP) Program - Title 19 CCR, Chapter 4.5
- Federal EPA Risk Management Program (RMP) - Title 40 CFR §68
- California Process Safety Management (PSM) Program, Title 8 CCR §5189
- Federal Process Safety Management (PSM) Program, Title 29 CFR §1910.119

Hereafter this program will be referred to as the RMP-PSM program.

This program is intended to be a "living document". As such, the information, procedures, policies, and documentation that make up this program must be made easily accessible and updated as necessary. To accomplish this, Legacy Packing and Cold Storage has elected to use PSMWriter, software developed and distributed by Resource Compliance, Inc. This software will assist us with updating, maintaining, scheduling, and tracking RMP-PSM related activities. 

1.1 Legacy Packing and Cold Storage, Risk and Process Safety Management Program

This is to inform all interested persons, including employees, that Legacy Packing and Cold Storage has updated/developed their unified RMP-PSM Program. This program has been prepared to address the risks involved in operating and maintaining the following processes which have the presence of hazardous chemicals above threshold quantities: 

Process Name                      | Process Chemical                      | Process Quantity(lbs.)
Ammonia Refrigeration               Anhydrous Ammonia                       63,000

Our RMP-PSM program promotes overall plant, worker, and public safety. The program enables our facility to prevent the occurrence, and minimize the consequences, of significant releases of hazardous chemicals. Overall, the program is designed to prevent accidental fatalities, injuries, illnesses and physical property damage.

Our company has many policies and procedures in place to promote overall plant, worker and public safety. We have: 
1. Prepared a uni

fied program based on the PSM plan to meet CalARP and RMP obligations as well
2. Organized the program so that it meshes closely with general business practices
3. Utilized PSMWriter software to ensure that all necessary employees have access to relevant information (SOPs, PHAs, audits, etc.)

The RMP-PSM program sets forth rules, procedures and practices that will help our employees and neighbors protect themselves.

1.2 Process Description

1.2.1 Facility Overview

Legacy Packing & Cold Storage operates a commercial cold storage for a variety of fruit in Dinuba, CA. The facility has an ammonia refrigeration system that provides refrigeration capacity to the following:

(10) Rooms
(8) Precools
(2) Loading Docks
(1) Bin Room
(5) Degreening Rooms

1.2.2 Facility Location

Legacy Packing Cold Storage is located at 38773 Road 48 Dinuba CA, 93618. The latitude and longitude of the machinery room is 36.495284, -119.469497. The facility is located approximately 3 miles east of state highway 99 in a rural area surrounded primarily by agriculture land.
According to FEMA Flood Map Service, the facility is not located in a special flood hazard area.
Legacy Packing Cold Storage is not located in an Alquist-Priolo Fault Zone as defined by the California Department of Conservation. In addition, a review of United States Geological Survey (USGS) fault maps revealed that there are no faults in close proximity to the site. The USGS 2018 One-Year Model revealed that Legacy Packing Cold Storage had a 1-2% chance of experiencing potentially minor-damage due to ground shaking in 2018.

1.2.3 Description of Covered Process

The refrigeration system is a combination between a flooded and pumped overfeed system. The refrigerated spaces are equipped with air-cooling evaporators and accumulators, or equipped with only air-cooling evaporators. 

All control valve groups are located on the roof to provide easy access. The refrigeration machinery is contained within or directly adjacent to t

he machinery room.

1.2.5 Process Classification

The ammonia refrigeration system at Legacy Packing Cold Storage consists of vessels, equipment, and valves which are interconnected by piping. As such, the refrigeration system at Legacy Packing Cold Storage is treated as a single process.

1.3 General Accident Release & Chemical Specific Prevention Steps

1.3.1 General 

We inform our employees engaged in process operations of the dangers of an accidental release of anhydrous ammonia in annual safety meetings. During these meeting we also discuss preventative measures, such as evacuation, in order to be prepared for a release.

Legacy Packing and Cold Storage has also conducted an off-site consequence analysis of worst-case and alternative release scenarios for the ammonia refrigeration process. These are for the purposes of informing the public in the event of an accidental release. The results of the analyses are reported in PSMWriter and hard copy binders. 

1.3.2 Anhydrous Ammonia

The ammonia refrigeration process at the Legacy Packing and Cold Storage facility is an integral part of the overall business and operates most of the year. It is extremely important that this process is maintained and operated in a safe and efficient manner. Management is committed to making sure that employees are made aware of the potential danger of an ammonia leak.
Our refrigeration personnel monitor the ammonia refrigeration process and keep active records of all procedures and transactions that pertain to ammonia. In addition, the process is checked frequently by one of the outside refrigeration contractors that we use. These contractors also assist in performing the annual mechanical integrity inspection of our ammonia equipment. 

1.4 Five Year Accident History

Legacy Packing and Cold Storage has had no accidental release within the last five (5) years.

1.5 Emergency Action and Response Plan

Legacy Packing and Cold Storage's emergency action and response program has been d

eveloped to satisfy the following requirements:
- California "Emergency Action Plan" - Title 8 CCR §3220
- Federal "Emergency Action Plan" - Title 29 CFR §1910.38
- California "Hazardous Waste Operations and Emergency Response" (HAZWOPER) - Title 8 CCR Title 8 §5192(q)
- Federal "Hazardous Waste Operations and Emergency Response" (HAZWOPER) - Title 29 CFR §1910.120(q)

Every year we review with our employees our evacuation procedures in the event of an emergency, including a hazardous chemical release.

1.6 Planned Changes to Improve Safety

Legacy Packing and Cold Storage has implemented many policies and procedures to promote overall plant, worker and public safety. Nevertheless, Legacy Packing and Cold Storage continually strives to improve in all areas, including safety.

By utilizing PSMWriter software, all necessary employees have access to every aspect of the RMP-PSM program. This has improved Legacy Packing and Cold Storage's ability to communicate hazardous situations to employees and contractors. In addition, PSMWriter tracks all RMP-PSM related events so that Legacy Packing and Cold Storage's management team can ensure that the RMP-PSM program is being implemented.

Legacy Packing and Cold Storage has implemented all aspects of the RMP-PSM program. When a RMP-PSM program requirement is completed (i.e. mechanical integrity inspection, process hazard analysis, compliance audit, etc.) any specific action items related to that event are entered into PSMWriter, assigned a responsible person, and given a due date. Once the action item has been completed, the resolution can be documented using PSMWriter as well. A list of current or past due action items can be accessed at any time by those with access to PSMWriter.

In addition to utilizing PSMWriter to create, schedule, track, and document events, Legacy Packing and Cold Storage has also entered into a contract with Resource Compliance to obtain help with RMP-PSM program implementation.

For the future, Legacy

Packing and Cold Storage now thinks of the RMP-PSM program as a "living document". It is an interactive framework that guides safe action for Legacy Packing and Cold Storage employees, but allows for feedback and continual improvement. Through the RMP-PSM program Legacy Packing and Cold Storage will continue to maintain overall plant worker and public safety.
